subject: Climate & Environment
title: Lead in Drinking Water
description: A short lesson to help you apply Lead in Drinking Water.

hook.text: In 2014, Flint, Michigan switched its water source. Lead levels in children's blood doubled.

buildup.text: The new river water corroded old lead pipes, leaching the metal into every tap.

discovery.text: Lead damages developing brains permanently. There is no safe level of exposure for children.

twist.text: Officials knew about the problem for months and told residents the water was safe.

climax.text: Millions of homes across the US still have lead service lines carrying drinking water.

punchline.text: Flint wasn't unique. It was just the one that got caught.

quiz.question: What caused the Flint water crisis?
options: Corrosive water leached lead from old pipes
A factory spill contaminated the reservoir
